reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the train from Seville to Cordoba and spent one night at the hotel. The hotel is very close to the station and is within walking distance to the Juderia. The rooms are nice and cosy and the staff is friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Very convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: not a 4 star hotel, staff completely indifferent and ignorant, terrible breakfast (dry bread, no coffee service, just a cheap machine dispensing vile coffee, poor variety of food), virtually non-existent wifi in the room, badly designed bathroom with the shower splashing water all over, danger of slipping while getting in and out of the bath, especially for children or older travelers, complicated and unreliable shower system. Only good things are proximity to the bus and train station and the size of the room.
reviews.title: General disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent hotel. It's a four star but it could very well be a 5 star. Very clean, easy to find and close to all major attractions. Restaurants and bars close to the hotel. The hotel has a parking garage, the rooms are very spacious and nicely decorated. We paid under 50.00 euros per night including tax.
reviews.title: Hotel Cordoba Center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spend three days in cordoba, first choice is a cosy old hotel in juderia. But we got this offer: two nights for 103 euro. The hotel is well situated and very comfortable. The room spacious and nice. The bathroom nice. Parking is under the hotel and closed. The price for parking quite high i have to admit.16 euro a day. I would say the hotel is just excellent because we got this price. Normally it is much more expensive and than i prefer a small hotel in the old center.
reviews.title: An offer you cannot refuse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The spa and swimming pool were closed in february.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I toured Andalucia staying at four hotels in the region including three nights at the Cordoba Center. Although the Cordoba Center hotel was the most expensive of the four, it was by far the worst.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel at all costs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we checked in the clerk was much more interested in a conversation her colleague was having with a tour representative than attending to us and she didn’t bother to explain where the room and lifts were or the breakfast arrangements. She just pushed the key card over the counter turned away and joined the conversation.
reviews.title: Looks good from the outside, but NOT friendly to seniors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was reasonably modern but very badly maintained. When my wife sat on the bed it partially collapsed. The bathroom was a disaster area. One of the wash basins was blocked and half full of dirty water, it stayed like that until 6pm on our last day. The spray part of the bidet tap was missing so when it was turned on a powerful jet of water shot at knee height soaking both you and the floor. The shower was over the bath and to get in or out you had to step over the high and wide bath surround. The shower screen only deflected the water onto the floor so when stepping out of the bath you had to negotiate the high step and try and avoid slipping on the flooded floor. No paper tissues were provided and the meager toiletries were never replaced.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, appalling staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay included buffet breakfast. This was not served in the hotel restaurant but by one or two staff in a large room that had the atmosphere and appearance of a factory canteen. The selection and quality of food was very poor and the only way to obtain tea or coffee was to make it yourself using a small machine. On two of the three days there was no fresh fruit only tinned, no salt and pepper and on the last morning no spoons.
reviews.title: On the whole, a good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the second day we awoke to find that there was no hot water. When I called reception there was no apology only “Water broken - fixed in one hour”. In one hour I called again to be given exactly the same message. After a cold shower we went down for breakfast . The breakfast room resembled a bomb site with the unoccupied tables full of dirty dishes, customers complaining and only one waitress trying to look after dozens of people. The Manager eventually turned up and cleared a table for us after a long wait.
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband, daughter and I stayed in this hotel while we visited Cordoba. The room was large and the bathroom had two sinks. The toilet had a separate door. This made it very easy for the three of us to share the room. We also had a car, and it was simply to keep it in the hotel garage. The location was perfect--just outside the old city and an easy walk to all the sites! The room was very very quiet--we could not hear our neighbors at all! The staff was courteous and helpful. The only downside to the tons of fresh fruit, cereal, eggs, meat etc. available for breakfast was the terrible nestle machine coffee, but all the hotels we stayed at in Spain which offered breakfast had the same terrible machines--we ended up getting coffee at small cafes! Otherwise, this hotel was great!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in Cordoba!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been for a two days stay in Cordoba and we have spent really good time at Hotel Cordoba Center.
reviews.title: Good Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: It's just a little bit far from the historical centre (the "mezquita"), you will need a 20~25 minute of walking, but the hotel itself was really good, our room (just a standar double bed) was really wide and with 2 french size bed. And it was clean, even if the moquette in the corridor was a little bad smalling!
reviews.title: clean and comfortable, at a nice price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I liked staying at the Hotel Cordoba Center because of the fact that they offer you luxury at a very nice price. The hotel is really big, and the service is rather reserved, but the rooms are spacious and tidy, the breakfast good and the location excellent. We would have liked better coffee, though...
reviews.title: Some negative points

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We choose the hotel for its free WiFi, and for the inhouse public parking with direct access to the hotel.
reviews.title: not as good as I'd hoped

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel for 3 reasons: the price, the good ratings, and the swimming pool.
reviews.title: A business hotel for everyone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now I would recommend it also for its spacious and quiet rooms, the wide, firm beds, the free wifi, and the location (a bit outside the city center, but still convenient, and close to the commercial area).
reviews.title: Comfortable choice convenient for railway station

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is business style, so don’t expect a great charm. Anyway, is clean, modern, and functional. Hotel parking is expensive, but I had no problem parking in the area.
reviews.title: Great 4* hotel good for leisure and business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Some things to be improved: The gym is nothing but a small room with a bicycle and treadmill, the swimming pool opens a bit late in the morning, the wifi doesn’t seem to work right in some places, and the staff is somewhat indifferent. Still, a great place to stay, specially if you get a good rate.
reviews.title: Don't expect the wifi to work in your room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel as we wanted an upper-grade hotel close to the railway station. For this, at about 10 minutes walk away, it fits the bill perfectly. It's also an easy 15-20 minute walk from the historic centre, and closer to the main shops. The room was clean, comfortable and very spacious - it also had an internal door between the closet/bathroom area and the main room, which cut out virtually all noise from the corridor. Predominantly business-oriented, the atmosphere is perhaps a bit sterile, and the front desk service a was little indifferent, but this was no big deal. The rooftop sun terrace and pool was a big bonus, perfect for relaxing after sight-seeing. If you're on a room-only option, and don't fancy paying an extra 10 euros for breakfast, there's a decent little cafe across the street where you can get one for 3. With rooms available for 50 euros in advance, it offers great value.
reviews.title: Good hotel but quality of service may vary
